text: The 2018–19 South Carolina Gamecocks women's basketball team represents the University of South Carolina during the 2018–19 NCAA Division I women's basketball season. The Gamecocks, led by eleventh year head coach Dawn Staley, play their home games at the Colonial Life Arena and were members of the Southeastern Conference. They finished the season 23–10, 13–3 in SEC play to finish in second place. They lost in the quarterfinals of the SEC Women's Tournament to Arkansas. They received an at-large bid to the NCAA Women's Tournament where they defeated Belmont and Florida State in the first and second rounds before losing to Baylor in the Sweet Sixteen. ==Previous season== The Gamecocks finished the 2017–18 season 29–7, 12–4 in SEC play to finish in a tie for second place. They defeated Tennessee, Georgia and Mississippi State to win the SEC Women's Tournament to earn an automatic bid to the NCAA Women's Tournament.South Carolina snaps Mississippi State's 32-game winning streak to win 4th straight SEC title They defeated North Carolina A&T; and Virginia in the first and second rounds, Buffalo in the sweet sixteen before losing to Connecticut in the elite eight.UConn routs South Carolina 94-65, heads back to Final Four ==Offseason== ===Departures=== {| class="wikitable sortable" border="1" ! Halton Arena in Charlotte, North Carolina. ==Rankings== ^Coaches' Poll did not release a second poll at the same time as the AP. ==References== Category:South Carolina Gamecocks women's basketball seasons South Carolina Gamecocks South Carolina
